intro: Graffenrieda glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in small glands, giving it its scientific name. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Graffenrieda glandulosa is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and understory habitats.
